page.title: 08ATTINGHAM PARK
page.content:
ATTINGHAM PARK,a stately home, was built for the first{Lord Berwick}in 1785.It celebrates its bicentenary this year.On the death of the eighth Lord Berwick in 1947 Attingham was bequeathed to the{National Trust.}The gift comprised the house and park,the whole estate including thirteen farms and covered 3,826 acres.The mansion and grounds are open to the public. There is a tearoom and a shop selling a wide range of National Trust souvenirs.There is a schoolroom available for use by visiting school parties.This facility has been made possible by converting the Brewhouse and Washhouse.Many events are held at Attingham including concerts,plays and special outdoor events.
{
